title: 外國左膠話香港成功抗疫係因為WHO

replies.msg:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/17/test-trace-lessons-hong-kong-avoiding-coronavirus-lockdown

https://twitter.com/richarddawkins/status/1251418534640402433?s=21

香港抵抗武漢肺炎嘅成功係外國出曬名，但係依家d左膠鬼佬就係度話香港成功係因為遵從左WHO嘅指引。

所以麻煩大家打twitter戰線嘅時候注重宣傳下「香港係因為無信中國同世衛先抗疫成功」同埋「醫護罷工先迫使封關」呢兩個要點。

就咁貼下面呢啲圖都得：



同埋the guardian係咁大張報紙，無理由比佢post埋呢啲fake news

所以麻煩大家send email比
guardian.readers@theguardian.com

呢容大約如下：

Dear Ms Ribbans,

I am writing to report a recent news article titled "Test and trace: lessons from Hong Kong on avoiding a coronavirus lockdown" dated 17 April 2020 by Ms. Sarah Boseley for being misleading and contrary to the truth. (https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/17/test-trace-lessons-hong-kong-avoiding-coronavirus-lockdown)

In short, the reason behind Hong Kong's success in combating the Wuhan Coronavirus is that we, the people of Hong Kong, acted the exact opposite of WHO's advice. For instance, our medical practitioners went on strike to force the government to shut down its border with China, while WHO was "not recommending" any forms of travel restriction. Besides, we ignored WHO's advice of not wearing masks. The details of the aforementioned incidents could be verified via the following news reports:
https://hongkongfp.com/2020/02/02/no-choice-hong-kong-medical-workers-agree-strike-mainland-border-closures/
https://hongkongfp.com/2020/03/12/coronavirus-wear-face-masks/

As a Hong Kong citizen, I am deeply offended by the post as it utterly dismissed the collective efforts of the Hong Kong people in combating the pandemic. As a regular reader of yours, I have always counted on the authenticity of The Guardian. I am deeply disappointed that such plainly false content could be published in the "News" section. I am hereby seeking removal of the particular news article concerned and clarification regarding this issue. Thank you for your attention.

Best Regards,
(你個名)

replies.msg:
Test and trace: lessons from Hong Kong on avoiding a coronavirus lockdown
Semi-autonomous city followed WHO advice and moved swiftly to stem contagion without rigid curbs on movement
Coronavirus – latest updates
See all our coronavirus coverage
Sarah Boseley Health editor
Fri 17 Apr 2020 23.30 BST
Share on FacebookShare on TwitterShare via Email
Governments in Europe and the US can learn from Hong Kong, which has kept infections and deaths from Covid-19 low without resorting to the socially and economically damaging lockdown that the UK and other countries have imposed, scientists say.
Hong Kong, with a population of nearly 7.5 million, had had just 715 confirmed cases of Covid-19 infection, including 94 asymptomatic infections, and four deaths as of March 31, according to a new study published on Friday in the Lancet.
Early in the pandemic, it was thought to be at significant risk because of travellers arriving from mainland China, but since early February the outbreak has appeared to be under control.
Q&A
Coronavirus: should everyone be wearing face masks?

Show
The semi-autonomous city took the route that the World Health Organization recommends and embarked on a rigorous programme of testing everyone with symptoms. Those who tested positive were quarantined in hospital. All their contacts over recent days were traced and instructed to self-isolate. In early March, about 400 outpatients and 600 inpatients were being tested every day.

quote.msg:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/17/test-trace-lessons-hong-kong-avoiding-coronavirus-lockdown

https://twitter.com/richarddawkins/status/1251418534640402433?s=21

香港抵抗武漢肺炎嘅成功係外國出曬名，但係依家d左膠鬼佬就係度話香港成功係因為遵從左WHO嘅指引。

所以麻煩大家打twitter戰線嘅時候注重宣傳下「香港係因為無信中國同世衛先抗疫成功」同埋「醫護罷工先迫使封關」呢兩個要點。

就咁貼下面呢啲圖都得：



同埋the guardian係咁大張報紙，無理由比佢post埋呢啲fake news

所以麻煩大家send email比
guardian.readers@theguardian.com

呢容大約如下：

Dear Ms Ribbans,

I am writing to report a recent news article titled "Test and trace: lessons from Hong Kong on avoiding a coronavirus lockdown" dated 17 April 2020 by Ms. Sarah Boseley for being misleading and contrary to the truth. (https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/17/test-trace-lessons-hong-kong-avoiding-coronavirus-lockdown)

In short, the reason behind Hong Kong's success in combating the Wuhan Coronavirus is that we, the people of Hong Kong, acted the exact opposite of WHO's advice. For instance, our medical practitioners went on strike to force the government to shut down its border with China, while WHO was "not recommending" any forms of travel restriction. Besides, we ignored WHO's advice of not wearing masks. The details of the aforementioned incidents could be verified via the following news reports:
https://hongkongfp.com/2020/02/02/no-choice-hong-kong-medical-workers-agree-strike-mainland-border-closures/
https://hongkongfp.com/2020/03/12/coronavirus-wear-face-masks/

As a Hong Kong citizen, I am deeply offended by the post as it utterly dismissed the collective efforts of the Hong Kong people in combating the pandemic. As a regular reader of yours, I have always counted on the authenticity of The Guardian. I am deeply disappointed that such plainly false content could be published in the "News" section. I am hereby seeking removal of the particular news article concerned and clarification regarding this issue. Thank you for your attention.

Best Regards,
(你個名)
